content: मोहः [मुह्-घञ्] {@--1@} Loss of consciousness, fainting, a swoon, insensibility; मोहेनांतर्वरतनुरियं लक्ष्यते मुच्यमाना <ls>V. 1. 8</ls>; मोहादभूत्कष्टतरः प्रबोधः <ls>R. 14. 56</ls>; <ls>Ku. 3. 73.</ls> {@--2@} Perplexity, delusion, embarrassment, confusion; यज्ज्ञात्वा न पुनर्मोहपेवं यास्यसि पांडव <ls>Bg. 4. 35.</ls> {@--3@} Folly, ignorance, infatuation तितीर्षुर्दुस्तरं मोहादुडुपेनास्मि सागरं <ls>R. 1. 2</ls>; <ls>Ś. 7. 25.</ls> {@--4@} Error, mistake. {@--5@} Wonder, astonishment. {@--6@} Affliction, pain. {@--7@} A magical art employed to confound an enemy. {@--8@} (In <ab>phil.</ab>) Delusion of mind which prevents one from discerning the truth (makes one believe in the reality of worldly objects and to be addicted to the gratification of sensual pleasures). {@--9@} Illusion of attachment or love; <ls>Pt. 2. 166.</ls>
